docs.lead_paragraph: Now that more than 80 percent of insured Americans are enrolled in some form of managed care, any politician who promises to defend them from unfair managed care practices can hardly lose. That point eluded the Republican leadership until last week, when Speaker Newt Gingrich, having spent months trying to fend off a popular patients' rights bill crafted by a fellow Republican, Charlie Norwood, finally clambered aboard the pro-consumer wagon. Mr. Gingrich has fooled us before, but for now the prospects seem better for a bipartisan bill the country will surely welcome.
docs.abstract: Editorial urges Republican leaders to get on with task of passing meaningful consumer safeguards related to managed health care; says rough draft of Republicans' patients' rights bill looks promising (M)
